poem:
"Farage, Brought to Stage"

On our isle, rhetoric, sour and harsh,
Built on stilted views, does Farage march.
Pinching whispers of discord from the air,
To fan the flames of unjust fear.

Yet we, as Britons, will draw near,
In simmering pot of love, not fear.
Yes, Mr Farage, strong values we clutch,
But of bigotry, perhaps, you speak too much.
